name: ome Ser
scenarioDescription:
The ome Ser Exoplanetary System

ome Ser is a star with 2.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 12.3 times its radius. It is located 250.85 light years away from the solar system.

ome Ser is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

ome Ser b

ome Ser b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2013-08. Its semi-major axis is 1.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 277.02 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, ome Ser.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.106, which means that when ome Ser b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.98 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 1.22. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of ome Ser b is 540.28 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, ome Ser b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system ome Ser, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
